disclaimerData.disclaimer:
PATIENT AGREEMENT: This form aims to inform you about the potential benefits and risks of laser hair reduction. Please read this information attentively and discuss any questions fully with your provider before proceeding.

You should take the necessary time to consider this treatment carefully, weighing all your alternatives before making an informed decision. It is essential that you know you have the right to seek a second opinion, and you are encouraged to ask any questions that occur to you at any stage of the process.

Laser hair reduction uses concentrated light energy to target the melanin in hair follicles, decreasing hair growth gradually. The procedure impairs the follicle to hinder future hair production and is effective for both facial and body areas. Multiple sessions are necessary because hair grows in cycles, with treatment focusing only on hairs in the active growth phase.

Outcomes depend on skin type, hair color, thickness, hormonal factors, medications, and compliance with aftercare instructions. Dark hair on light skin tends to respond best; light or gray hair responds less effectively. No promises of complete or permanent reduction can be made due to individual variations.

Several treatments at 4-8 week intervals may be required. Skin sensitivity following treatment can persist for up to 14 days. I will be informed of each session's details and the practitioner involved. I may withdraw my consent at any time.

RISKS AND POSSIBLE REACTIONS: Common effects include redness, swelling, mild discomfort (similar to a rubber band snap), sensitivity to sunlight for up to 14 days. Skin may feel tender or resemble mild sunburn.

Less common: temporary pigment changes (darker or lighter patches), blistering, crusting, which may last longer or, rarely, become permanent. Risk of eye injury if not properly protected.

Rare: burns, scarring, infection, increased hair growth in the treated area (paradoxical hypertrichosis). Allergic reactions to topical cooling agents are possible.

I understand risks from both known and unknown causes and I accept them. I have disclosed my complete medical history.

I confirm I have been provided with advice regarding the reasons for treatment, risks (general and personal), benefits, alternatives including no treatment, uncertainties, likelihood of success, and follow-up care.

MEDICAL IMAGERY: I authorize clinical photographs and videos to be taken for my confidential medical records.

I have discussed my objectives; all my questions have been answered satisfactorily. No new information affects my decision. I consent to this procedure. This document supersedes any previous information.

questions.content: Do you understand the information that has been provided to you?
Do you feel enough information has been shared for you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent willingly and without pressure?
Do you have any current health conditions?
Are you pregnant or breastfeeding at present?
Do you have a neuromuscular disorder (for example, Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune disease?
Do you currently have any skin concerns?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection in the area where the treatment is planned?
Are you currently taking any antibiotics or other prescription medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in full detail.
What are your aims and what results are you hoping to achieve from this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you had this or a similar treatment before? If so, were there any complications? Please provide details.
Do you have any worries or concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there any other information we need to know? Please provide a comprehensive account.
I will retain this information during my treatment period and refer to it as necessary.
